codearea.control

Interface TextEditingArea

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClipboardActions, EditActions, NavigationActions
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CodeArea, InlineCssTextArea, InlineStyleTextArea, StyleClassedTextArea, StyledTextArea

    public interface TextEditingArea
    Interface for a text editing control. Defines the core methods. Other interfaces define default higher-level methods implemented on top of the core methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAnchor()
      Returns the selection anchor.
      int getCaretColumn()
      Returns the caret's position within the current line.
      int getCaretLine()
      Returns the line with the caret.
      int getCaretPosition()
      Returns the current caret position as an offset in the text.
      int getLength()
      Returns the number of characters in this text-editing area.
      java.lang.String getLine(int index)
      Returns the given line of text.
      java.lang.String getSelectedText()
      Returns the selected text.
      javafx.scene.control.IndexRange getSelection()
      Returns the current selection range.
      java.lang.String getText()
      Returns content of this text-editing area.
      default void replaceText(javafx.scene.control.IndexRange range, java.lang.String text)
      Replaces a range of characters with the given text.
      void replaceText(int start, int end, java.lang.String text)
      Replaces a range of characters with the given text.
      void selectRange(int anchor, int caretPosition)
      Positions the anchor and caretPosition explicitly, effectively creating a selection.

    • Method Detail

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Returns the number of characters in this text-editing area.

      • getText

        java.lang.String getText()
        Returns content of this text-editing area.

      • getLine

        java.lang.String getLine(int index)
        Returns the given line of text.

      • getCaretPosition

        int getCaretPosition()
        Returns the current caret position as an offset in the text.

      • getCaretLine

        int getCaretLine()
        Returns the line with the caret.

      • getCaretColumn

        int getCaretColumn()
        Returns the caret's position within the current line.

      • getAnchor

        int getAnchor()
        Returns the selection anchor. If there is no selection, this is the same as caret position.

      • getSelection

        javafx.scene.control.IndexRange getSelection()
        Returns the current selection range.

      • getSelectedText

        java.lang.String getSelectedText()
        Returns the selected text.

      • selectRange

        void selectRange(int anchor,
                 int caretPosition)
        Positions the anchor and caretPosition explicitly, effectively creating a selection.

      • replaceText

        void replaceText(int start,
                 int end,
                 java.lang.String text)
        Replaces a range of characters with the given text. It must hold 0 <= start <= end <= getLength().
        Parameters:
        start - Start index of the range to replace, inclusive.
        end - End index of the range to replace, exclusive.
        text - The text to put in place of the deleted range. It must not be null.

      • replaceText

        default void replaceText(javafx.scene.control.IndexRange range,
                         java.lang.String text)
        Replaces a range of characters with the given text.
        Parameters:
        range - The range to replace. It must not be null.
        text - The text to put in place of the deleted range. It must not be null.
        See Also:
        replaceText(int, int, String)
